overview:
Kate Connally has been building casual games businesses that develop brands and programming for focused demographic groups for over ten years.

She was instrumental in identifying the female casual gamer when she was running the first downloadable games business at Shockwave. Most recently, she built the AddictingGames business into one of the top media brands for teen-age boys. She is now building a parent-controlled network for family games on touchscreens. Founder and CEO of tadami Video Playground, she and veterans of Leapfrog and Nickelodeon are building an interactive video platform for kids on tablets and handsets.

She began her career with Volpe, Welty & Company, and has held posts with Advent International, Macromedia, Inc. and Nickelodeon / MTV Networks. Connally graduated cum laude from Princeton University with a bachelorâ€™s degree in history. In 2010, she was named by “Fast Company” magazine among the “Most Influential Women in Games.”
